events.title: Mahatma Gandhi begins Salt March
events.description: Mahatma Gandhi starts the 240-mile Salt March to Dandi, India, to protest British salt taxes.
events.significance: This event was a pivotal act of nonviolent civil disobedience that galvanized the Indian independence movement against British colonial rule.

events.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's First Fireside Chat
events.description: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivers his first 'fireside chat,' addressing Americans about the banking crisis during the Great Depression.
events.significance: This marked an innovative use of radio to directly communicate with the public, restoring confidence in the banking system.

events.title: Republic of China Established
events.description: Sun Yat-sen is declared provisional president of the Republic of China following the fall of the Qing Dynasty.
events.significance: This event signifies the end of over two thousand years of imperial rule in China and the founding of a republican government.

events.title: Anschluss: Germany annexes Austria
events.description: Nazi Germany formally annexes Austria, an event known as the Anschluss, as part of Hitler's expansionist policies.
events.significance: This was a significant step in Nazi Germany's aggressive expansion leading up to World War II.
